site_name: Telephone Kiosk Outside43 Surbiton RoadKingston Upon ThamesKT1 2HG

constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: AIRCZ Type:: Gatwick Airport Wind Turbine Consultation Zone:Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Gatwick Airport Limited, 7th Floor Destinations Place, London Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH06 0NP

AIRCZ Type:: Heathrow Planning Consultation Zone: All buildings, structures, erections and works exceeding 90 metres in height (295.3 feet)Contact: The Safeguarding Department, Heathrow Airport Limited, c/o Planning Services, First Point, Buckingham Gate, Gatwick Airport, West Sussex, RH6 0NT

description: Relocation of BT public payphone kiosk from the junction of Woodbines Avenue/Penrhyn Road, Kingston to outside no 43 Surbiton Road, Kingston
decision_conditions: Development  shall  be  carried  out  in  accordance  with  the  materials  specified  on  the approved plans and on the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

Prior to the commencement of any below groundworks the applicant shall agree in writing with the Local Planning Authority a  construction method statement demonstrating that the proposed method of construction would not damage the street tree immediately north of the proposed kiosk site. The development shall only be carried out in accordance with the approved method statement.Reason: To protect the health and wellbeing of the street tree and the visual amenity of the area in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The applicant is informed that the submitted details, as set out above are agreed and that  Condition Condition 5 (Tree Protection Plan) of planning application 20/02577/HOU are hereby fully approved.
Please provide a payment of Â£300 to accompany your application. This payment can be made online at www.kingston.gov.uk or by calling our Customer Care Line on 020 8547 5022
